intro: Strobilopanax neoebudicus, commonly known as the neoebudic palm, is a unique tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers followed by dark, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
